item.title: fall-2020
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: we were alive, but really we were dead
item.content:encoded: swordsmen sing among equinox flowers a fawn forages specter sets a trap around corners grow shadows no moon in skull town scale, fearless that spiny slope, unbowed hand pyramid, firm walking faster by cutting corners of acute sidewalks swollen with sugar lazy day leaves strange aftertaste an inside moral war how to write haiku without ever stepping outside I ran so far away the big hungry winter cuddle then devour upend my dirty growl behind my angry howl warm hearth filled with stronger fire &ndash; hope in overcast skies little in this world decided by one person too much is

item.title: fall-winter 2019
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall subjects follow as queen bows her head &ndash; almost winter&rsquo;s turn flock of ducks survey centennial waters sun bids the cold

item.title: fall-winter 2018
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall to her autumn means outside ball is everything grey room fits dying leaves, not how he feels winter before happened two fraternal hounds &ndash; dry yard grass no order in time&rsquo;s quanta next does not exist
